When this is all over, we need to get rid of ALL private LTC facilities. Vulnerable seniors should NOT be at the mercy of private health corporations / owners. I am watching (and involved) with how this is unfolding in Ontario - we are not far behind this scenario. #COVID19Canada

This segment on CBC about all the ways that public health got it wrong on coronavirus is missing some pretty incredible gaps: they go with gotchas (boarder closures and masks) rather than looking at the total failure to protect the most vulnerable: folks living in LTC.

On that horrific Dorval seniors’ home, Legault gives a bad answer: “public health tried to intervene but the owner wouldn’t co-operate.”  How can an LTC owner where 31 people died have the choice to not co-operate? FFS, politicians are fining individuals $800 for being in a park!

Today we lost my glamorous and kind Tante Jackie to Covid-19. She was 89, in the early stage of Alzheimer's and in a LTC home in Montreal. She started having virus symptoms last Sunday, tested positive and was moved to hospital. My cousins couldn't be with her at the end.  https://t.co/a0rBjD7Jc8
